name: Picasso Labs
slogan: Automated creative measurement platform that enhances creativity through objectivity
description:
As imagery and video dominate the way brands communicate with consumers, marketers have no data to understand which visual properties resonate and, more importantly, why. Picasso Labs is bringing creative into the data age by providing an AI solution that measures how consumers' real-time response to imagery changes based on the unique visual properties of each creative, anywhere. 

In 5 years, we believe that every successful creative decision will be powered by Picasso Labs data.  Since our founding 18 months ago, Picasso has been selected as one of Unilever's most innovative marketing companies of 2016 and helps brands like Unilever, Warner Music, Volvo, Farfetch, and Samsung understand the visual preferences of their audience, reduce creative guesswork, and improve marketing performance. Backed by Harrison Metal, Index Ventures, and other fantastic investors, we're a team of 9 & currently on the lookout for others to join us on our quest for world domination.

team.title: Founder & CEO
team.name: Anastasia Leng
team.bioHtml: Founder of @Picasso Labs & @Hatch. 5+ years @Google. Lived on 4 continents, speak 3 languages, triple major from UPenn.

team.title: Software Engineer
team.name: Lina Lei
team.bioHtml: Software engineer at Picasso Labs. Previously CPA in public accounting.

team.title: Software Engineer
team.name: Rishin Doshi
team.bioHtml: Experience with C++, Ruby, Rails, React, PostgreSQL, Python,

perks.title: Option grants for all team members
Education budget for continued professional development

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager (London / NYC)
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology is used globally by CMOs and VPs of Media and Insights at Fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Mondelez, Heineken and AB inBev to measure creative efficiency, consistency and impact across all creatives worldwide.
 
We believe objectivity empowers creativity. Our AI platform powers and automates digital brand governance, measures media effectiveness, and provides a detailed diagnosis of which creative attributes are actually working hardest for your brand.
 
Picasso Labs was selected as one of Unilever's most innovative marketing technology companies, one of the 6 "Most Contagious companies of 2017", and one of Unilever's most ambitious startups of the last 5 years.
 
We’re looking for a proven customer success professional who thrives on delivering an excellent customer experience in a new technology market. You’ll be one of the founding members of the Picasso Labs Customer Success team, in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will be responsible for hunting retaining and expanding existing client relationships.
 
Required Attributes:

- Exceptional at communicating, both orally and in writing
- Highly organised and meticulous with details and data
- Problem solver, who can work under pressure of client deadlines and expectations
- Ability to think creatively and innovatively
- A strategic thinker who is confident presenting to C-suite stakeholders.
- Team player, whilst able to work autonomously without direction
- High urgency and strong work ethic
- Willing to invest in company culture and go above and beyond your job description
 
Responsibilities:

- Manage relationship with VP and director level stakeholders within existing clients
- First point of contact for all non-support related queries from clients and their agency/platform partners
- Conduct trainings for new users and act as subject matter expert for our technology
- Guardian of customer health and product adoption, reporting on key metrics to senior management
- Expand relationships with existing clients and identify incremental revenue opportunities through additional use cases
- Represent the company at marketing events and trade shows
- Commercial negotiation of contract renewals and expansion agreements
 
Preferred Qualifications / Experience:

- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
- 3+ years' of experience in a customer success / account management role
- Previous experience working in or with marketing, branding or advertising teams
- Previous experience at a SaaS company.
- Start-up experience preferred
 
But these are definitely not deal breakers! If you think you could really succeed in this role, please get in touch.
 
Compensation for the role includes a base salary and bonus based on net retention goals.

jobs.title: Executive Assistant / Office Manager (London)
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology helps the world's largest brands make better, and more data-driven, creative decisions about the way they use imagery and video to communicate, and cut-through, with their consumers. We've built award winning technology used by the world's best brands, and, after raising our Series A in 2019, are growing rapidly and need ambitious and driven people to join our team. 

We're looking for someone who's a jack of many trades and can balance the responsibilities of an office manager, HR associate, and executive assistant all in one. We are looking for a generalist who is not afraid on picking up a range of different tasks daily. You will perform a myriad of job functions and your role is integral to the continued achievement and successful running of our company. You will be reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer. 

On a day-to-day, you may be asked to assist with the following: 
* Assisting the organisation's HR function by keeping personnel records up to date, arranging interviews and so on
* Organising onboarding programmes for new employees and scheduling interviews for hiring candidates. 
* Implementing and maintaining procedures/office administrative systems
* Organise company events both internally and externally
* Track/approve daily expenses and prepare weekly, monthly or quarterly reports
* Act as an office manager by keeping up with office supply inventory
* Various accounting and reconciliation tasks, such as creating and sending invoices. 
* Assist senior level staff with special projects. 

We're looking for someone who has:
* Excellent administration and organisational skills.
* Excellent communication skills with an energetic, upbeat and enthusiastic demeanor 
* The ability to learn quickly
* A can-do attitude and flexibility and goes the extra mile
* Work experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant or similar role
* PA diploma or certification is a plus
* Experience with Quickbooks is a plus. 

Benefits of working at Picasso Labs: 
* Access to private health insurance 
* Generous holiday time, which includes 25 days off plus bank holidays plus an 2 additional weeks off during Christmas time 
* Central London office location (London Bridge) 
* Open, transparent, and collaborative working environment 
* Pension scheme

jobs.title: Operations Associate (London)
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology helps the world's largest brands make better, and more data-driven, creative decisions about the way they use imagery and video to communicate, and cut-through, with their consumers. We've built award winning technology used by the world's best brands, and, after raising our Series A in 2019, are growing rapidly and need ambitious and driven people to join our team. 

We're looking for someone to join our Product and Operations Teams as an Ops Associate, where you'll be responsible for the onboarding and implementation of our largest clients. 

On a day-to-day, you'll be contributing to the following: 
* Assisting the operations team with onboarding new clients and liaising directly with senior managers of the world's top brands 
* Project managing and performing various tasks to get new users set up in the Picasso Labs system
* Contributing to product trainings that expose new users to the benefits of using Picasso Labs 
* Various data entry tasks to train our visual recognition system, such as building training sets
* Analysing the success of our onboarding teams and recommending possible areas for process improvement. 

We're looking for someone who has:
* Excellent organisational skills.
* Strong communication skills and can effectively communicate with both internal and external stakeholders
* Quick learner who can pick up complex technical information 
* Can do attitude and flexibility and goes the extra mile

Benefits of working at Picasso Labs: 
* Access to private health insurance 
* Generous holiday time, which includes 25 days off plus bank holidays plus an 2 additional weeks off during Christmas time 
* Central London office location (London Bridge) 
* Open, transparent, and collaborative working environment 
* Pension scheme

jobs.title: Operations Manager (NYC)
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology helps the world's largest brands make better, and more data-driven, creative decisions about the way they use imagery and video to communicate, and cut-through, with their consumers. We've built award winning technology used by the world's best brands, and, after raising our Series A in 2019, are growing rapidly and need ambitious and driven people to join our team. 

We're looking for someone to join our Product and Operations Teams as an Ops Manager, where you'll be responsible for the onboarding and implementation of our largest clients. 

On a day-to-day, you'll be contributing to the following: 
* Serving as the client's main day to day contact during the onboarding and implementation period to ensure they're setup for success
* Project managing the setup of every new US and LATAM client to ensure they can successfully use our products from day one. 
* Building new processes to enhance how our operations procedures are run. 
* Collaborating with the sales lead and customer success manager to successfully onboard clients, while overseeing the work done by Operations Associates to ensure we hit our time and quality milestones.  
* Consulting during sales calls and advising potential clients on the best way to get setup with Picasso Labs 
* Analysing the success of our onboarding teams and recommending possible areas for process improvement to the company leadership. 

We're looking for someone who has:
* Excellent organisational skills.
* Strong communication skills and can effectively communicate with both internal and external stakeholders
* Quick learner who can pick up complex technical information 
* Can do attitude and flexibility and goes the extra mile

Benefits of working at Picasso Labs: 
* Access to private health insurance 
* Generous holiday time, which includes 25 days off plus bank holidays plus an 2 additional weeks off during Christmas time 
* Central London office location (London Bridge) 
* Open, transparent, and collaborative working environment 
* Pension scheme

jobs.title: Product Management Director
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology helps the world's largest brands make better, and more data-driven, creative decisions about the way they use imagery and video to communicate, and cut-through, with their consumers.

As the Director of Product Management, you will be a key company leader for owning and driving the innovative new features and capabilities to grow Picasso Labs' customers and revenue. You will have responsibility for multiple product lines and life cycles as well as the product strategy, prioritization, and execution of feature development.

What You'll Do
--Define and guide the long term product strategy for growing the products and features that Picasso Labs offers.
--Lead and collaborate with Engineering, Design, and Product Operations to continuously ship improvements to our products. 
--Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products.
--Collaborate closely with our buyers, users, and Customer Success to deeply understand and address user needs.
--Partner with Marketing and Sales to drive revenue growth via customer acquisition, retention, and upsell. 

What You'll Need
--Independent Product Ownership: You have demonstrated the ability to drive and deliver on the entire product lifecycle.
--Leadership: You have a proven ability to evangelize new products and features to both customers and cross-functional team members, aligning the entire team around a product strategy and vision for the market.
--Communication: You are able to clearly and effectively communicate your ideas to different stakeholders, both verbally and in writing. 
--Business Acumen: You have experience defining product strategy that balances business and user experience goals. 
--Analytical Skills: You have a bias towards collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data to discover actionable insights that drive key business decisions.  

Preferred Qualifications
-Knowledge of and/or strong interest in marketing/advertising.
-Experience in working in a B2B or marketing environment.
-Software development experience.
-Strong understanding of Machine Learning concepts and techniques. 

Perks and Benefits
--Employee equity plan
--Buy whatever hardware setup you need to be effective
--Work from home / remotely whenever you need to, or want to
--Unlimited vacation
--Comprehensive health, dental, vision, plans
--Dog-friendly workplace
--Snacks galore
--A company that listens to your ideas and where you can really make an impact

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology help the world's largest brands make better, and more data-driven, creative decisions about the way they use imagery and video to communicate, and cut-through, with their consumers. 

We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager who will be responsible for managing our go-to-market strategy and successfully launching our new products and features. You'll be responsible for all communication and positioning work and take the lead on developing marketing strategies to accelerate product adoption.  This will be a truly cross-functional role, and you'll be working closely with product, engineering, marketing, and sales. In many ways, you will be the glue between the commercial and technical sides of the company and you'll help us craft experience that delight our customers. 

Specifically you wIll:
* Lead the adoption and usage of our product with clear product positioning, naming, launch strategies and tactics. You'll work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to develop compelling, audience-specific messages, and drive alignment across our go-to-market strategy.
* Translate your strategy and messaging into sales enablement tools, playbooks, and other documents for the Commercial team.
* Provide internal and external thought leadership - you should enjoy writing, speaking, and generally evangelizing. 
* Deliver training to sales and other internal teams to build internal understanding of the product value props


What we're looking for: 
* Exceptional analytical skills, i.e. ability to assemble and interpret data, create executive summaries, and deliver actionable business insights
* Experience working with product teams and translating complex technical features into easy-to-understand concepts
* Ability to influence, motivate, and train others
* Proven track record in performing well in a fast-paced environment and organizational skills to effectively manage multiple projects
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• The ability to handle uncertainty and ambiguity well. You can make clear decisions without enough information
• Knowledge of and/or strong interest in marketing/advertising. 
• Idealism mixed with pragmatism
• Experience in working in a B2B or marketing environment is a plus. 


Perks and Benefits: 
• Employee equity plan
• Buy whatever hardware setup you need to be effective
• Work from home / remotely whenever you need to, or want to
• Unlimited vacation
• Comprehensive health, dental, vision, plans
• Dog-friendly workplace
• Snacks galore
• A company that listens to your ideas and where you can really make an impact.

jobs.title: Sales & Product Marketing Associate
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a creative and thoughtful marketing professional who gets a real buzz from setting and achieving ambitious performance based goals.You’ll be a founding member of the Picasso Labs sales & marketing team, working primarily with our business development manager, Georgia, whilst also communicating frequently with the product team to develop the messaging and market positioning of our tool. 

Picasso Labs is the first company building a technology solution to help brands be smarter about their creative. Our system not only measures measures how consumers' real-time response to imagery and video changes based on the unique visual properties of each creative, but also ensures that every single image and video produced is consistent with your brand guidelines and meets all of your best practice goals. We work with the top fortune 500 companies in the world, including Google, ABinBev, Unilever, Samsung, Motorola, and more. We’re VC backed, revenue-generating, and a close-knit team who’s worked at Google, Yahoo, GE, & Accenture, and holds degrees from Columbia, Cornell, Cambridge, and UPenn.. 

 
In a nutshell, your job will be to develop, implement and execute strategic marketing plans that communicate the value of Picasso Labs to potential customers.  As a Sales & Product Marketing Associate at Picasso Labs, your responsibilities will include the following: 

--Developing positioning and messaging for all of Picasso Labs' product launches. 
--Creating collateral to aid with and optimise sales processes e.g. industry specific overview decks, website copy, blog posts, sample insights reports, training guides etc. 
--Working with existing customers to coordinate and produce case studies
--Coordinating and executing PR launches to showcase our company and building a strong external brand presence for Picasso Labs. 
--Sitting in on sales meetings in order to identify what the team needs to maximise sales
--Communicating with the product and engineering team to understand how the product is developing and how this can be reflected in our marketing output
--Analyzing the results of our activities and inputting into marketing strategy to drive revenue and sales. 


To be successful in this role, we think you’ll need to be: 
- A compelling story-teller who is exceptional at communicating, both verbally and written
- Able to understand and fulfill the needs of both product and sales teams 
- Highly organised and meticulous with details
- Ability to think creatively and innovatively 
- Obsessed with product and equally fanatical about supporting our customers
-  A strategic thinker who is confident presenting to C-suite stakeholders. 

We’d also like it if you have all or any of these: 
-  A degree from a top-tier school 
-  Previous experience working in or with marketing, branding or advertising teams. 
-  Previous experience at a SaaS company. 

But these definitely aren’t deal breakers!  If you think you could really fly in this role, please drop us a line and let’s talk.

Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology is used globally by CMOs and VPs of Media and Insights at Fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Mondelez, Heineken and AB inBev to measure creative efficiency, consistency and impact across all creatives worldwide.
 
We believe objectivity empowers creativity. Our AI platform powers and automates digital brand governance, measures media effectiveness, and provides a detailed diagnosis of which creative attributes are actually working hardest for your brand.
 
Picasso Labs was selected as one of Unilever's most innovative marketing technology companies, one of the 6 "Most Contagious companies of 2017", and one of Unilever's most ambitious startups of the last 5 years.
 
We’re looking for an early stage sales professional who thrives on bringing a new technology to market. You’ll be one of the founding members of the Picasso Labs sales team, in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will be responsible for hunting prospective new clients within a targeted account list.
 
Required Attributes:

- A compelling story-teller who is exceptional at communicating, both orally and in writing
- Highly organised and meticulous with details
- Ability to think creatively and innovatively
- A strategic thinker who is confident in crafting communications that will resonate with C-suite stakeholders.
- Team player, whilst able to work autonomously without direction
- High urgency and strong work ethic
- Results driven mindset, comfortable working under pressure of KPI targets
- Willing to invest in company culture and go above and beyond your job description
 
Responsibilities:

- Prospect new business within a named account list via a combination of phone, social and email outreach
- Represent the company at marketing events and trade shows
- Report on KPI metrics to senior management on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
- Work closely with the sales team to define weekly strategy, including priority targets and messaging
- Maintain internal CRM system to ensure accurate record of outreach and lead funnel
 
Preferred Qualifications / Experience:

- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
- 6 - 18 months experience in an SDR/B2B sales role, with regular KPI targets
- Understanding of the digital marketing and social media landscape
- Previous experience at a SaaS company and/or start-up preferred
 
 
But these are definitely not deal breakers! If you think you could really succeed in this role, please get in touch.
 
Compensation for the role includes a base salary and commission based on qualified opportunities and deals sourced.

Picasso Labs is an automated creative excellence platform that aims to enhance creativity through objectivity. Our technology is used globally by CMOs and VPs of Media and Insights at Fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Mondelez, Heineken and AB inBev to measure creative efficiency, consistency and impact across all creatives worldwide.

We believe objectivity empowers creativity. Our AI platform powers and automates digital brand governance, measures media effectiveness, and provides a detailed diagnosis of which creative attributes are actually working hardest for your brand.

Picasso Labs was selected as one of Unilever's most innovative marketing technology companies, one of the 6 "Most Contagious companies of 2017", and one of Unilever's most ambitious startups of the last 5 years.

  • Team player, whilst able to work autonomously without direction
  • High urgency and strong work ethic
  • Results driven mindset, comfortable working under pressure of KPI targets
  • Willing to invest in company culture and go above and beyond your job description

  • Represent the company at marketing events and trade shows
  • Report on KPI metrics to senior management on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
  • Work closely with the sales team to define weekly strategy, including priority targets and messaging
  • Maintain internal CRM system to ensure accurate record of outreach and lead funnel

  • 6 - 18 months experience in an SDR/B2B sales role, with regular KPI targets
  • Understanding of the digital marketing and social media landscape
  • Previous experience at a SaaS company and/or start-up preferred

But these are definitely not deal breakers! If you think you could really succeed in this role, please get in touch.

Compensation for the role includes a base salary and commission based on qualified opportunities and deals sourced.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (NYC)
jobs.description:
We’re looking for software engineers to join our growing team. We work hard, debate a lot, and laugh incessantly. We're backed by Harrison Metal, Index Ventures, and Saatchi & Saatchi. We're also lucky to count senior execs at AirBnB, Twitter, and Google as our investors and advisors. Our existing team has worked at Google, Yahoo, GE, & Accenture, and holds degrees from Columbia, Cornell, Princeton, Cambridge, and UPenn, among others. 

Who We Are: 
As imagery and video increasingly dominate the way we communicate, brands have limited data to understand which visual properties resonate with their users and, more importantly, why. Picasso Labs is bringing creativity into the data age by providing an AI solution that measures how consumers' real-time response to imagery and video changes based on the unique visual properties of each creative, across all the social, paid, and owned platforms that matter. 

Picasso was recently selected as one of Unilever's most innovative marketing companies of 2016, 2017, and 2018 and helps brands like Unilever, Louis Vuitton, Four Seasons, Tesco, and Google understand the visual preferences of their audience, reduce creative guesswork, and improve marketing performance. Using our data, our clients have changed the album cover for a #1 Top Billboard 100 artist, expanded into new markets, launched new products, and optimized lots of creatives, all with confidence knowing that their creative decisions are backed by hard facts. And we’ve saved them hours of times and oodles of guesswork by providing analytics that demystify the performance of any creative, anywhere. 

What we look for: 
We value engineers who love data and appreciate the quantitative side of life (a background in math, physics, statistics, or economics is music to our ears). People who look for an agile environment and love to work on an autonomous but closely-knit team would thrive here. Also, it's important to us that the person who joins wants to contribute to growing the company overall, and while your main job will be programming, we prefer to work with people who speak up and make their voice heard when it comes to other aspects of our product, including design, UX, and feature development. 

Our ideal new teammate is someone who likes to learn new things and stretch themselves. We know lots of places say that, so what do we mean? If you think that a new piece of tech that you've been experimenting with on the weekends would help us work better, encourage us to test it out. We're looking for people who'll actively want to make our technology stack (and our company) better!

Perks and Benefits: 
• Employee equity plan
• Buy whatever hardware setup you need to be effective
• Work from home / remotely whenever you need to, or want to
• Unlimited vacation
• Comprehensive and fully comped health, dental, vision, plans
• Dog-friendly workplace
• Snacks galore
• A company that listens to your ideas and where you can really make an impact.
